sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Comoedia A worke in ryme, contayning an enterlude of myndes, witnessing the mans fall from God and Christ. Set forth by HN, and by him newly perused and amended. Translated out of Base-almayne, into English. Comoedia. English Niclaes, Hendrik, 1502?-1580?
32 leaves : ill. (woodcuts)
Printed by N. Bohmberg, [Cologne : 1574?]
HN = Hendrik Niclaes. In verse. Imprint from STC. Running title reads: An enterlude of myndes. The virgule after "ryme" in title is lightly printed. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

32 leaves : ill. (woodcuts)
Printed by N. Bohmberg, [Cologne : 1574?]
HN = Hendrik Niclaes. In verse. Imprint from STC. Running title reads: An enterlude of myndes. The virgule after "ryme" in title is lightly printed. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
